text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies.

Lately, I’ve been eating a lot of soup and
I found these awesome Wonder Woman cookie cutters!

So I thought, let’s combine those things,
today we’re gonna be making Wonder Woman Tomato Soup!
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 2 cans
of diced tomatoes, these are each 28 ounces,

and then you’re gonna need 2 little cans of
tomato juice, these are each 5.5 ounces, then

you’re gonna need a 6 ounce can of tomato paste.
You’re also gonna need 1 cup of vegetable broth.

And then this part is optional, it’s 1/2
a cup of heavy cream, I like a creamy tomato soup,

but if you have a allergy to dairy like my
sister does, then you’ll probably want to skip this

part, that’s OK. You’re gonna need 2 bay
leaves, a little bit of red pepper flakes for a

little bit of spice, 1 tablespoon of butter,
1 cup of basil, 2 stalks of parsley and,

2 sprigs of thyme, I actually have these growing
outside in my backyard, so that really came

in handy. You’re also gonna need 2 cups
of chopped onion, 1 and 1/2 tablespoons of garlic,

1 cup of chopped celery, 1 cup of chopped
carrots and we’re gonna need some cheese,
we’re gonna be decorating, I’m using a medium cheddar cheese. And we’re gonna be using these

awesome cookie cutters that I found online, I’ll put a
link down below if you’re interested in getting them.

I can’t wait to show you what we’re gonna
be doing with these, it’s a very simple and fun idea.
Alright, let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is chop
our veggies!

I’ve got a cutting board and a sharp cutting
knife, and I’m gonna start with my carrots.

Just gonna grab a bunch of ‘em, and chop,
chop, chop, chop, chop.

And be careful, don’t get your fingers.
Then we’re gonna scoop a cup of these carrots
into our big saucepan. Then celery.

Now our onion, you’re gonna cut off the
ends, I like to peel them like this. Then I like to

cut them in half, and then I like to cut them
in half again, then I just slice.
Oh my eyes! It’s Wonder Woman’s weakness!
Scoop up 2 cups and throw them in the pot.

Next, take your garlic, and we’ve already
peeled out 4 cloves, and we’re gonna chop 'em up.

We need 1 and 1/2 tablespoons, and then we’re
gonna add it to the pot.

Lastly we’re gonna chop up our basil, but
we’re not gonna add it to the pot, we’re just gonna put

it back into a bowl, off to the side and remember,
we want 1 cup.

Now we’re gonna bring our pot of veggies
over to the stove.

Turn your stove on to medium heat and add
some olive oil, and your bay leaves. Let this
cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Next, add the 2 cans of diced tomatoes, then
add half of our chopped basil, we’ll add the other

half later. And you’re gonna add thyme and
parsley, and I’ve tied them together because
we'll be removing these after the flavor sets in.

Next, we add the vegetable broth, tomato juice,
tomato paste, I’m just scooping it in ‘dere!

And, our cream. For flavor, this is optional,
I like to add a little salt, fresh ground pepper,

and a pinch of sugar. Now we want to bring
the mixture to a boil, once it starts bubbling, turn

the heat down to a simmer, cover with a lid,
and let it cook for 30 minutes.

After 30 minutes, we’ll remove the
lid, and you’re gonna remove the thyme, parsley
and bay leaves.

Then we’re gonna add our final ingredients,
add the rest of our basil, the pepper flakes,

and a little bit of butter. Stir together until
everything is combined.

I just took the soup off of the stove, it’s
really hot, so be careful! And I’m gonna

pour it into this blender and blend it up so it’s nice
and smooth.

Oh my, oh my gosh! Oh my gosh I wish I was
a little bit taller!

Fun fact, graceful is Wonder Woman’s middle
name!

And you guys didn’t see it, but my invisible
plane bumped me… So…
And now mix it together!

Now that the soup is ready, we’re gonna
add our decorative finishes, I’m so excited, we’re gonna

be using our Wonder Woman cookie cutters.
And, I took the piece of cheese and I cut
it into 3 separate slices, about 1/4 inch thick.
A-ha! I cut the cheese over here! Oh-arh!

Alright and then you’re gonna take your cookie
cutter, and you’re gonna place it right

on top and we’re gonna cut out the design, just like
a cookie. Peel off the excess cheese, gently
push it out.

Then you’re gonna take your second, smaller
cookie cutter, place it right in the middle,
and then gently press it down about half way.

And there you have it! And you can make as
many as you would like!

I don’t know about you guys, but I love
eating crackers with my soup and I have 2

of my favorite crackers that I’m eating with soup right
now. The first one is from Cheez-It, I love

cheesy crackers with tomato soup because I always
like to put a little cheese on there. I think it goes

really well together. And these are the Scrabble
kind, they’re really fun!

I spelled out Wonder Woman Soup with the little
crackers!

And my second favorite are these little toast
crackers, they make me feel so fancy because

when I go to restaurants they have these kind
of crackers, and I’m like, ohhhhh so nice!

Now, here’s our soup and now we’re gonna
add cheese and crackers.

Ta-da! Here is Wonder Woman Tomato Soup, this
recipe serves 6 people, so there’s plenty to

share with friends and family. I’m gonna
be eating this for lunch today, so I’m super excited!

If you guys have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies please let me know!

Leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen.

Also you can follow me on Facebook, Tumblr,
Twitter and Instagram I’ll be posting lots of

pictures of our Wonder Woman Soup creation,
and if you guys make this soup, please send

me photos, I love seeing your baking creations,
I just get a big kick out of it!
Alright, thanks again you guys!
Bye-bye!
And, happy lunch! Om-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!
Ooooohhhhh! Oh my!
These smell really good!
